alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Henry; Madison (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 8:38PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Madison, northeastern Hancock and western Henry Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 838 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Anderson, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Madison, northeastern Hancock and western Henry Counties, including the following locations... Ingalls, Greensboro, Pendleton, Markleville, Sulphur Springs, Kennard, Shirley and Cadiz. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 between mile markers 215 and 225. Interstate 70 near mile marker 121. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central and east central Indiana.
